description.narrative: The project will contribute to make the link between climate change, environmental degradation and urban poverty visible through education, advocacy and increased dialogue so that municipal public policies address this problem adequately, actively involving civil society, youth and women's organizations in the identification of suitable actions and strategies.

WWF Bolivia har lämnat in ett programförslag till Sveriges ambassad i Bolivia för programmet “Soluciones Urbanas con Accion Ciudadana” för stöd för 20 MSEK mellan åren 2018-2020. Programmet ämnar öka civila samhällets kunskap om och inflytande i hållbar lokal stadsplanering och bidra till att synliggöra och öka kunskaperna kring kopplingen mellan klimatförändringar, miljöförstöring och urban fattigdom. WWF har i utvecklandet av programmet använt sig av den multidimensionella fattigdomsanalysen (MDPA) vilket har gett till en djupare förståelse av kontexten, problematiken och en tydlig identifiering av målgrupperna. Programmet innefattar tre resultatområden för att uppnå det övergripande syftet: 1) Barn och ungdomar i städer och speciellt fattiga områden i de utvalda kommunerna har kunskap om, kan analysera och känner sig delaktiga i frågor kring klimatförändringar och urbana miljöfrågor samt dess effekter på urban fattigdom. 2) Kommuner, ungdoms och kvinnoorganisationer i fattiga områden föreslår och implementerar urbana lösningar fokuserade kring resiliens kopplat till klimatförändringar och miljöfrågor inom områden som vatten, sophantering, transport och energi vilka kan bidra till minskad urban fattigdom 3) Civilsamhället (sociala gräsrotsorganisationer, universitet, frivilligorganisationer), företag och relevanta offentliga institutioner påverkar lokala policyers som möjliggör en utveckling av hållbara städer och bidrar till den nationella agendan för urban utveckling.

WWF Bolivia has submitted a proposal to the embassy of Sweden called "urban solutions with citizen action". The proposal for funding is 20MSEK between the years 2018-2020. The project will contribute to make visible the link between climate change and environmental and urban poverty so that municipal public policies address this problem adequately, actively involving civil society, children, youth and women's organizations in the identification of suitable actions and strategies.

participating-org.narrative: WWF/World Wide Fund for Nature, Bolivia
WWF/World Wide Fund for Nature, Bolivia

tag.narrative: 11.3 - By 2030, enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management in all countries.
11.3 - Till 2030 verka för en inkluderande och hållbar urbanisering samt förbättra kapaciteten för deltagandebaserad, integrerad och hållbar planering och förvaltning av bosättningar i alla länder.

11.5 - By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations.

11.5 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska antalet dödsfall och antalet människor som drabbas av katastrofer, inklusive vattenrelaterade katastrofer. Även tillse att de direkta ekonomiska förlusterna till följd av sådana katastrofer, i form av lägre global BNP, minskar väsentligt. Särskilt fokus bör ligga på att skydda de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer.
11.6 - By 2030, reduce the adverse per capita environmental impact of cities, including by paying special attention to air quality and municipal and other waste management.
11.6 - Till 2030 minska städernas negativa miljöpåverkan per person, bland annat genom att ägna särskild uppmärksamhet åt luftkvalitet samt hantering av kommunalt och annat avfall.
11.7 - By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.

11.7 - Senast 2030 tillhandahålla universell tillgång till säkra, inkluderande och tillgängliga grönområden och offentliga platser, i synnerhet för kvinnor och barn, äldre personer och personer med funktionsnedsättning.
13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
15.9 - By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts.
15.9 - Senast 2020 integrera ekosystemens och den biologiska mångfaldens värden i nationella och lokala planerings- och utvecklingsprocesser, i strategier för fattigdomsminskning samt i räkenskaper.

description.narrative:
Taken from annual CoP
During the month of February of last year, the Municipal Government of Tarija officially inaugurated the Environmental Education Center - Bientefue that has been equipped and designed with the support of the project. The project has also supported the centre with education for the centre staff and with voluntaries. During the few weeks of operation and before the confinement, many educational units participated in the activities offered. In order to broaden its educational offerings and make greater use of its facilities, agreements were reached with other institutions (NGOs and foundations) and local universities. During the pandemic, the CEA through its virtual platforms organized various activities, highlighting the cycle of green cinema, in which documentaries from the WWF network and others referring to environmental and climate change issues were broadcast, more than 8,000 thousand people followed this cycle. It also broadcast videos and other arts on solid waste management, efficient use of water and biodiversity. The CEA in coordination with young environmental activists organized the first volunteer days in the city of Tarija, 22 organizations and youth groups participated in it, an exhibition fair, in a central square of the city, allowed to know the actions, works and concerns of the young volunteers
An investigation on urban birds and native trees in the urban Biopark in the city of Tarija by a young university thesis has concluded. Work that had the technical support of professionals from the Bio Park and a university professor. A second investigation by technicians from the Bio Park, with the support of university professors and invited professionals, made it possible to identify seasonal and migratory birds in the area. Both investigations were presented to the population through social networks and will soon be printed. With the results of both investigations, virtual workshops were organized for university students, young activists, scout groups, etc. Later, several contests were organized such as: bird feeder design, children's story scripts, urban bird photography contest. A virtual course for small ornithologists crowned the activities in the area. More than 950 children and young people participated in these activities. In association with the organization of young volunteers "We Like Science", workshops were organized in the areas: La Pampa de la isla, El plan 3000, and Villa 1ro de mayo in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, which brings together a social fabric characterized by its great cultural diversity due to migration processes. The purpose of the workshops was to awaken among young people an interest in science and as from them to find answers to various environmental problems, they also intend to present it as an option for their professionalization. • Adapting the contents of the “We Like Science” workshops, two virtual workshops were organized. Between both workshops there were 822 participants from all over Bolivia. At the end of the workshops, the young people in small groups proposed a huge number of possible solutions to environmental problems in their surroundings. The project developed and validated with the teachers a pedagogical methodology appropriate to the virtual modality: "that of the inverted class", with virtual educational supports and content and hosted on our website.To do this, I develop digital educational material for primary and secondary level teachers. 200 teachers were capacitated and the word spread about the platform beyond the expectations of the project team.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
